page.title: 09INTERVIEW - BROWN FARM
page.content:
Attitudes to the Exmoor National Park. The local farmers are generally of the opinion that it is good to see some of the land uncultivated. They are mostly conservationists and those at Brown's Farms have planted five acres of coniferous woodland. Much of the land surrounding Clatworthy reservoir is owned by the Wessex water board who lease it to the farmers.
Government matters Subsidies from the government depend on the farm's acreage. In this area farmers usually receive less than Â£10 an acre anually.
